metadata.bijbeltekst: Psalm 103 (though textually focuses on the Feeding of the 5000)

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: Jesus transforms a world defined by scarcity and 'fantasy' into a reality of abundance through the Eucharistic act.

tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus radically disrupts how the world was thought to be
He took, he blessed, he broke, he gave
the wilderness has become a place of abundance
a narrative of well-being, satisfaction, abundance, and surplus
the world belongs to God and God is the creator of the abundant life
They all ate. They were all filled and satisfied
It invites us to bask in God’s shalom

helper.identificatie: The Eucharistic Verbs / The Church Gathering
tekstueel_bewijs: If we were not here together, we could adopt the story of our society
The one we know better is true... about scarcity
anxious rat-race the world puts upon us
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Scarcity is presented as a false 'world-system' or 'fantasy' that enslaves the imagination and dictates global policy.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The hearers, having received the new narrative, must now perform it in the world.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearers (Church)
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The primary program (Jesus acts) enables the secondary program (we act).

voorbeelden_god_subject: Jesus radically disrupts how the world was thought to be.
He enacted a Eucharist right there.
God is the creator of the abundant life.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We must fend off others to protect ourselves.

voorbeelden: knowing that we must fend off others
The story is a fantasy, the kind that the church enjoys
consider this: the reason we are here... is to entertain the radical thought
He enacted a Eucharist... they all ate
It invites us to act out that abundance

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on 'knowing' or 're-imagining' reality. It posits that the lack of 'Pouvoir' (power) in the world is due to a false 'Savoir' (the fantasy of scarcity).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: The sermon moves from the perceived reality of S2 (Scarcity) to the revelation that S2 is actually a negation of S1, finally landing on S1 as the only true reality.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Christ's performance of the Eucharist exposes the 'truth' of abundance, making the 'contrary' (scarcity) a lie.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High. Scarcity is treated as a powerful, systemic delusion.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is deeply theocentric. Jesus is the primary actor who 'jerks the disciples to attention' and performs the miracle. Human action is a response to a reality already established by God.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: It summons us to new policies... new money management

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: The world is transformed... by the force and presence of Jesus
He enacted a Eucharist right there in that deserted place for the hungry crowd without resources.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: The disciples are not models to follow; they are examples of failure and scarcity-thinking. Jesus is the only model, but more as a 'Performer of Reality' than a moral example.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides a theocentric reading: Jesus acts where humans cannot.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief from the 'rat-race' and a shift in worldview.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Salvation is a change of 'Lordship'—from the lordship of Scarcity to the lordship of Christ's Abundance.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the miracle story to the contemporary application is seamless because both are framed as a conflict between two competing narratives.
spanning_punten: The tension between the 'fantasy' of the miracle and the 'reality' of global hunger.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus radically disrupts how the world was thought to be... he continues to disrupt our world of scarcity.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon relies on the 'Word' and 'Sacrament' (Eucharistic verbs) to provide competence.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is defined as 'Anxiety' and 'Scarcity'—a systemic lie that governs human behavior.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God/Jesus as the Subject of the primary narrative. The hearer is correctly positioned as the Receiver of a new reality.

modale_halans.voorgestelde_balans: Increase Pouvoir (the actual empowerment of the Spirit).
modale_halans.concrete_suggestie: Explicitly mention how the Holy Spirit provides the power to live out this abundance, not just the 'imagination' to see it.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: The opponent (Scarcity) is already very well-defined and formidable.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in theocentric preaching that uses narrative structure to dismantle moralistic anxiety.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: A rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'fantasy/reality' trope; Greimas shows that the power lies in the Subject-switch from 'We hustle' to 'He gives'.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis might focus on the 12 baskets; Greimas focuses on the Axis of Transmission (God to Man).
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'Eucharistic Verbs' function as the 'Helper' that enables the Subject (Jesus) to overcome the Opponent (Scarcity).

appendices.notities: The sermon uses the concept of 'fantasy' ironically to redefine what is actually 'real'.
